newsitem.title: USA: BB&T prices $250 subordinated notes offering.
newsitem.headline: BB&T prices $250 subordinated notes offering.

text.p: BB&T Corp said Wednesday that the public offering of $250 million of principal amount of its 7.25 percent subordinated notes due 2007 priced at 99.533 percent of par.

The company said it would use the net proceeds from the offering for general corporate purposes, including the repurchase of up to 5.7 million shares of its common stock in connection with certain pending acquisitions expected to close this year.

This sale represents the second offering of debt securities under its 1996 shelf registration statement relating to $1 billion in debt securities of the corporation, the company said. In May 1996, BB&T offered $250 million principal amount of 7.05% Subordinated Notes due 2003.
